# Battle of Rauge

| result            = Swedish victory
| combatant1        =
| combatant2        =
| commander1        =  Wolmar Anton von Schlippenbach
| commander2        =  Boris Sheremetev
| strength1         = 2,000 men
| strength2         = 7,000 men
| casualties1       = 100 killed and wounded
| casualties2       = at least 2,000 killed, wounded and captured
}}
The Battle of Rauge took place on 15 September 1701 near RÃµuge, Livonia during the Great Northern War in which the Swedes defeated the numerically superior Russians.
